properties.areaDesc: Delaware, OK; Cherokee, OK; Mayes, OK; Muskogee, OK; Wagoner, OK
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 10 at 11:27AM CST until January 10 at 12:15PM CST by NWS Tulsa OK
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Southwestern Delaware County in northeastern Oklahoma...
Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma...
Eastern Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma...
Northwestern Cherokee County in east central Oklahoma...
North central Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma...

* Until 1215 PM CST.

* At 1127 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 5 miles west of Peggs to 3 miles northwest of
Muskogee, moving north at 45 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

* Locations in or near the path include...
Muskogee...                       Wagoner...
Pryor...                          Pryor Creek...
Fort Gibson...                    Chouteau...
Locust Grove...                   Salina...
Adair...                          Okay...
Hulbert...                        Spavinaw...
Tullahassee...                    Hoot Owl...
Peggs...                          Rose...
Leach...                          Spavinaw State Park...
Sportsmen Acres Community...      Sequoyah State Park...

This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 260 and 266.
properties.instruction:
Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly
from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the
basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
